page.title: 07SHREWTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The old school building in Shrewton was built and opened in 1869 using money subscribed by local people for the purpose. A newspaper report of the time describes how after the official opening a tea party was held in the main room where an Easter tree had been placed. The school now occupies two sites either side of the High Street and River Till. The old 1869 building still stands with some additions and now houses two classes of children aged 9 to 11 years of age. A third smaller classroom now houses the school library. The toilets are separate from the school building and are reached after crossing the playground. Behind the building is a garden with a small pond and 14 species of tree.
